member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.DataSourceErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceErrorCode.
If the reason that the synchronization failed is due to an error with the underlying data source, this field contains a code that identifies the error.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The Unix timestamp when the synchronization job completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
If the Status field is set to FAILED, the ErrorCode field indicates the reason the synchronization failed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
If the Status field is set to ERROR, the ErrorMessage field contains a description of the error that caused the synchronization to fail.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.ExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionId.
A identifier for the synchronization job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
Maps a batch delete document request to a specific data source sync job. This is optional and should only be supplied when documents are deleted by a data source connector.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The Unix timestamp when the synchronization job started.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJob.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The execution status of the synchronization job. When the Status field is set to SUCCEEDED, the synchronization job is done. If the status code is set to FAILED, the ErrorCode and ErrorMessage fields give you the reason for the failure.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics
member.summary: Maps a batch delete document request to a specific data source sync job. This is optional and should only be supplied when documents are deleted by a data source connector.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsAdded
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentsAdded.
The number of documents added from the data source up to now in the data source sync.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsDeleted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentsDeleted.
The number of documents deleted from the data source up to now in the data source sync run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsFailed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentsFailed.
The number of documents that failed to sync from the data source up to now in the data source sync run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsModified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentsModified.
The number of documents modified in the data source up to now in the data source sync run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetrics.DocumentsScanned
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentsScanned.
The current number of documents crawled by the current sync job in the data source.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget
member.summary: Maps a particular data source sync job to a particular data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The ID of the data source that is running the sync job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceSyncJobMetricTarget.DataSourceSyncJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceSyncJobId.
The ID of the sync job that is running on the data source.
If the ID of a sync job is not provided and there is a sync job running, then the ID of this sync job is used and metrics are generated for this sync job.
If the ID of a sync job is not provided and there is no sync job running, then no metrics are generated and documents are indexed/deleted at the index level without sync job metrics included.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping
member.summary: Maps attributes or field names of the documents synced from the data source to Amazon Kendra index field names. You can set up field mappings for each data source when calling CreateDataSource or UpdateDataSource API. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API to first create an index field and then map to the data source field. For more information, see Mapping data source fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping.DataSourceFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceFieldName.
The name of the field in the data source. You must first create the index field using the UpdateIndex API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping.DateFieldFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateFieldFormat.
The format for date fields in the data source. If the field specified in DataSourceFieldName is a date field, you must specify the date format. If the field is not a date field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping.IndexFieldName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexFieldName.
The name of the index field to map to the data source field. The index field type must match the data source field type.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceVpcConfiguration

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceVpcConfiguration.SecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupIds.
A list of identifiers of security groups within your Amazon VPC. The security groups should enable Amazon Kendra to connect to the data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DataSourceVpcConfiguration.SubnetIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetIds.
A list of identifiers for subnets within your Amazon VPC. The subnets should be able to connect to each other in the VPC, and they should have outgoing access to the Internet through a NAT device.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteAccessControlConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteAccessControlConfiguration operation. Deletes an access control configuration that you created for your documents in an index. This includes user and group access information for your documents. This is useful for user context filtering, where search results are filtered based on the user or their group access to documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteAccessControlConfigurationRequest.Id

The identifier of the access control configuration you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteAccessControlConfigurationRequest.IndexId

The identifier of the index for an access control configuration.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteAccessControlConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteAccessControlConfiguration operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteDataSourceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteDataSource operation. Deletes an Amazon Kendra data source connector. An exception is not thrown if the data source is already being deleted. While the data source is being deleted, the Status field returned by a call to the DescribeDataSource API is set to DELETING. For more information, see Deleting Data Sources.
Deleting an entire data source or re-syncing your index after deleting specific documents from a data source could take up to an hour or more, depending on the number of documents you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteDataSourceRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the data source connector you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteDataSourceRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index used with the data source connector.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteDataSourceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteDataSource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteExperienceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteExperience operation. Deletes your Amazon Kendra experience such as a search application. For more information on creating a search application experience, see Building a search experience with no code.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteExperienceRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of your Amazon Kendra experience you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteExperienceRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index for your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteExperienceResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteFaqResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteFaq operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteIndexRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteIndex operation. Deletes an existing Amazon Kendra index. An exception is not thrown if the index is already being deleted. While the index is being deleted, the Status field returned by a call to the DescribeIndex API is set to DELETING.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteIndexRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the index you want to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteIndexResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteIndex operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeletePrincipalMapping operation. Deletes a group so that all users and sub groups that belong to the group can no longer access documents only available to that group.
For example, after deleting the group "Summer Interns", all interns who belonged to that group no longer see intern-only documents in their search results.
If you want to delete or replace users or sub groups of a group, you need to use the PutPrincipalMapping operation. For example, if a user in the group "Engineering" leaves the engineering team and another user takes their place, you provide an updated list of users or sub groups that belong to the "Engineering" group when calling PutPrincipalMapping. You can update your internal list of users or sub groups and input this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping.
DeletePrincipalMapping is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The identifier of the data source you want to delete a group from.
A group can be tied to multiple data sources. You can delete a group from accessing documents in a certain data source. For example, the groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing" are all tied to the company's documents stored in the data sources Confluence and Salesforce. You want to delete "Research" and "Engineering" groups from Salesforce, so that these groups cannot access customer-related documents stored in Salesforce. Only "Sales and Marketing" should access documents in the Salesforce data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
The identifier of the group you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to delete a group from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingRequest.OrderingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderingId.
The timestamp identifier you specify to ensure Amazon Kendra does not override the latest DELETE action with previous actions. The highest number ID, which is the ordering ID, is the latest action you want to process and apply on top of other actions with lower number IDs. This prevents previous actions with lower number IDs from possibly overriding the latest action.
The ordering ID can be the Unix time of the last update you made to a group members list. You would then provide this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping. This ensures your DELETE action for that updated group with the latest members list doesn't get overwritten by earlier DELETE actions for the same group which are yet to be processed.
The default ordering ID is the current Unix time in milliseconds that the action was received by Amazon Kendra.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeletePrincipalMappingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeletePrincipalMapping operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation. Deletes a block list used for query suggestions for an index.
A deleted block list might not take effect right away. Amazon Kendra needs to refresh the entire suggestions list to add back the queries that were previously blocked.
DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockList is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the block list you want to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index for the block list.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeFeaturedResultsSet operation. Gets information about a set of featured results. Features results are placed above all other results for certain queries. If there's an exact match of a query, then one or more specific documents are featured in the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetRequest.FeaturedResultsSetId
member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeFeaturedResultsSet operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.CreationTimestamp
member.summary:

The Unix timestamp when the set of the featured results was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.Description
member.summary:

The description for the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.FeaturedDocumentsMissing
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedDocumentsMissing.
The list of document IDs that don't exist but you have specified as featured documents. Amazon Kendra cannot feature these documents if they don't exist in the index. You can check the status of a document and its ID or check for documents with status errors using the BatchGetDocumentStatus API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.FeaturedDocumentsWithMetadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedDocumentsWithMetadata.
The list of document IDs for the documents you want to feature with their metadata information. For more information on the list of featured documents, see FeaturedResultsSet.

member.summary:

The identifier of the set of featured results.

member.summary:

The name for the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.LastUpdatedTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedTimestamp.
The timestamp when the set of featured results was last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.QueryTexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryTexts.
The list of queries for featuring results. For more information on the list of queries, see FeaturedResultsSet.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeFeaturedResultsSetResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the set of featured results. When the value is ACTIVE, featured results are ready for use. You can still configure your settings before setting the status to ACTIVE. You can set the status to ACTIVE or INACTIVE using the UpdateFeaturedResultsSet API. The queries you specify for featured results must be unique per featured results set for each index, whether the status is ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CapacityUnits.
For Enterprise Edition indexes, you can choose to use additional capacity to meet the needs of your application. This contains the capacity units used for the index. A query or document storage capacity of zero indicates that the index is using the default capacity. For more information on the default capacity for an index and adjusting this, see Adjusting capacity.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary:

The current status of the index. When the value is ACTIVE, the index is ready for use. If the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains a message that explains why.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribePrincipalMapping operation. Describes the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups. This includes information on the status of actions currently processing or yet to be processed, when actions were last updated, when actions were received by Amazon Kendra, the latest action that should process and apply after other actions, and useful error messages if an action could not be processed.
DescribePrincipalMapping is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingRequest.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The identifier of the data source to check the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingRequest.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
The identifier of the group required to check the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index required to check the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribePrincipalMapping operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
Shows the identifier of the data source to see information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
Shows the identifier of the group to see information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.GroupOrderingIdSummaries
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupOrderingIdSummaries.
Shows the following information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups:
Status—the status can be either PROCESSING, SUCCEEDED, DELETING, DELETED, or FAILED.
Last updated—the last date-time an action was updated.
Received—the last date-time an action was received or submitted.
Ordering ID—the latest action that should process and apply after other actions.
Failure reason—the reason an action could not be processed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribePrincipalMappingResponse.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
Shows the identifier of the index to see information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockList operation. Gets information about a block list used for query suggestions for an index.
This is used to check the current settings that are applied to a block list.
DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockList is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when a block list for query suggestions was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description for the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
The error message containing details if there are issues processing the block list.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSizeBytes.
The current size of the block list text file in S3.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index for the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.ItemCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemCount.
The current number of valid, non-empty words or phrases in the block list text file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The IAM (Identity and Access Management) role used by Amazon Kendra to access the block list text file in S3.
The role needs S3 read permissions to your file in S3 and needs to give STS (Security Token Service) assume role permissions to Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.SourceS3Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceS3Path.
Shows the current S3 path to your block list text file in your S3 bucket.
Each block word or phrase should be on a separate line in a text file.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the block list. When the value is ACTIVE, the block list is ready for use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsBlockListResponse.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when a block list for query suggestions was last updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfig operation. Gets information on the settings of query suggestions for an index.
This is used to check the current settings applied to query suggestions.
DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfig is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index with query suggestions that you want to get information on.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfig operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.AttributeSuggestionsConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeSuggestionsConfig.
Configuration information for the document fields/attributes that you want to base query suggestions on.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.IncludeQueriesWithoutUserInformation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludeQueriesWithoutUserInformation.
TRUE to use all queries, otherwise use only queries that include user information to generate the query suggestions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.LastClearTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastClearTime.
The Unix timestamp when query suggestions for an index was last cleared.
After you clear suggestions, Amazon Kendra learns new suggestions based on new queries added to the query log from the time you cleared suggestions. Amazon Kendra only considers re-occurences of a query from the time you cleared suggestions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.LastSuggestionsBuildTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastSuggestionsBuildTime.
The Unix timestamp when query suggestions for an index was last updated.
Amazon Kendra automatically updates suggestions every 24 hours, after you change a setting or after you apply a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.MinimumNumberOfQueryingUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinimumNumberOfQueryingUsers.
The minimum number of unique users who must search a query in order for the query to be eligible to suggest to your users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.MinimumQueryCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinimumQueryCount.
The minimum number of times a query must be searched in order for the query to be eligible to suggest to your users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
Whether query suggestions are currently in ENABLED mode or LEARN_ONLY mode.
By default, Amazon Kendra enables query suggestions.LEARN_ONLY turns off query suggestions for your users. You can change the mode using the UpdateQuerySuggestionsConfig API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.QueryLogLookBackWindowInDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryLogLookBackWindowInDays.
How recent your queries are in your query log time window (in days).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Whether the status of query suggestions settings is currently ACTIVE or UPDATING.
Active means the current settings apply and Updating means your changed settings are in the process of applying.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeQuerySuggestionsConfigResponse.TotalSuggestionsCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalSuggestionsCount.
The current total count of query suggestions for an index.
This count can change when you update your query suggestions settings, if you filter out certain queries from suggestions using a block list, and as the query log accumulates more queries for Amazon Kendra to learn from.
If the count is much lower than you expected, it could be because Amazon Kendra needs more queries in the query history to learn from or your current query suggestions settings are too strict.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeThesaurusResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the thesaurus. When the value is ACTIVE, queries are able to use the thesaurus. If the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field provides more information.
If the status is ACTIVE_BUT_UPDATE_FAILED, it means that Amazon Kendra could not ingest the new thesaurus file. The old thesaurus file is still active.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DescribeThesaurusResponse.SynonymRuleCount

member.summary:

The number of unique terms in the thesaurus file. For example, the synonyms a,b,c and a=>d, the term count would be 4.

member.summary:

Lists the users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source that failed to properly remove access to your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DisassociatePersonasFromEntitiesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DisassociatePersonasFromEntities operation. Removes the specific permissions of users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source with access to your Amazon Kendra experience. You can create an Amazon Kendra experience such as a search application. For more information on creating a search application experience, see Building a search experience with no code.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DisassociatePersonasFromEntitiesRequest.EntityIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityIds.
The identifiers of users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source. For example, user IDs could be user emails.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DisassociatePersonasFromEntitiesRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DisassociatePersonasFromEntitiesRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index for your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DisassociatePersonasFromEntitiesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DisassociatePersonasFromEntities operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DisassociatePersonasFromEntitiesResponse.FailedEntityList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailedEntityList.
Lists the users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source that failed to properly remove access to your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document
member.summary: A document in an index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.AccessControlConfigurationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessControlConfigurationId.
The identifier of the access control configuration that you want to apply to the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.AccessControlList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessControlList.
Information on principals (users and/or groups) and which documents they should have access to. This is useful for user context filtering, where search results are filtered based on the user or their group access to documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
Custom attributes to apply to the document. Use the custom attributes to provide additional information for searching, to provide facets for refining searches, and to provide additional information in the query response.
For example, 'DataSourceId' and 'DataSourceSyncJobId' are custom attributes that provide information on the synchronization of documents running on a data source. Note, 'DataSourceSyncJobId' could be an optional custom attribute as Amazon Kendra will use the ID of a running sync job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.Blob
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Blob.
The contents of the document.
Documents passed to the Blob parameter must be base64 encoded. Your code might not need to encode the document file bytes if you're using an Amazon Web Services SDK to call Amazon Kendra APIs. If you are calling the Amazon Kendra endpoint directly using REST, you must base64 encode the contents before sending.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The file type of the document in the Blob field.
If you want to index snippets or subsets of HTML documents instead of the entirety of the HTML documents, you must add the HTML start and closing tags (<HTML>content</HTML>) around the content.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.HierarchicalAccessControlList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HierarchicalAccessControlList.
The list of principal lists that define the hierarchy for which documents users should have access to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
A identifier of the document in the index.
Note, each document ID must be unique per index. You cannot create a data source to index your documents with their unique IDs and then use the BatchPutDocument API to index the same documents, or vice versa. You can delete a data source and then use the BatchPutDocument API to index the same documents, or vice versa.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.S3Path
member.summary: Gets and sets the property S3Path.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Document.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The title of the document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttribute
member.summary: A document attribute or metadata field. To create custom document attributes, see Custom attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttribute.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The identifier for the attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttribute.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The value of the attribute.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeCondition
member.summary:
The condition used for the target document attribute or metadata field when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra. You use this with DocumentAttributeTarget to apply the condition.
For example, you can create the 'Department' target field and have it prefill department names associated with the documents based on information in the 'Source_URI' field. Set the condition that if the 'Source_URI' field contains 'financial' in its URI value, then prefill the target field 'Department' with the target value 'Finance' for the document.
Amazon Kendra cannot create a target field if it has not already been created as an index field. After you create your index field, you can create a document metadata field using DocumentAttributeTarget. Amazon Kendra then will map your newly created metadata field to your index field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeCondition.ConditionDocumentAttributeKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConditionDocumentAttributeKey.
The identifier of the document attribute used for the condition.
For example, 'Source_URI' could be an identifier for the attribute or metadata field that contains source URIs associated with the documents.
Amazon Kendra currently does not support _document_body as an attribute key used for the condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeCondition.ConditionOnValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConditionOnValue.
The value used by the operator.
For example, you can specify the value 'financial' for strings in the 'Source_URI' field that partially match or contain this value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeCondition.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The condition operator.
For example, you can use 'Contains' to partially match a string.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeTarget
member.summary:
The target document attribute or metadata field you want to alter when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra.
For example, you can delete customer identification numbers associated with the documents, stored in the document metadata field called 'Customer_ID'. You set the target key as 'Customer_ID' and the deletion flag to TRUE. This removes all customer ID values in the field 'Customer_ID'. This would scrub personally identifiable information from each document's metadata.
Amazon Kendra cannot create a target field if it has not already been created as an index field. After you create your index field, you can create a document metadata field using DocumentAttributeTarget. Amazon Kendra then will map your newly created metadata field to your index field.
You can also use this with DocumentAttributeCondition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeTarget.TargetDocumentAttributeKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetDocumentAttributeKey.
The identifier of the target document attribute or metadata field.
For example, 'Department' could be an identifier for the target attribute or metadata field that includes the department names associated with the documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeTarget.TargetDocumentAttributeValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetDocumentAttributeValue.
The target value you want to create for the target attribute.
For example, 'Finance' could be the target value for the target attribute key 'Department'.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeTarget.TargetDocumentAttributeValueDeletion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetDocumentAttributeValueDeletion.
TRUE to delete the existing target value for your specified target attribute key. You cannot create a target value and set this to TRUE. To create a target value (TargetDocumentAttributeValue), set this to FALSE.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValue
member.summary: The value of a document attribute. You can only provide one value for a document attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValue.DateValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateValue.
A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string.
It is important for the time zone to be included in the ISO 8601 date-time format. For example, 2012-03-25T12:30:10+01:00 is the ISO 8601 date-time format for March 25th 2012 at 12:30PM (plus 10 seconds) in Central European Time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValue.LongValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LongValue.
A long integer value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValue.StringListValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StringListValue.
A list of strings. The default maximum length or number of strings is 10.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValue.StringValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StringValue.
A string, such as "department".

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValueCountPair
member.summary: Provides the count of documents that match a particular document attribute or field when doing a faceted search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValueCountPair.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
The number of documents in the response that have the attribute/field value for the key.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValueCountPair.DocumentAttributeValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributeValue.
The value of the attribute/field. For example, "HR".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentAttributeValueCountPair.FacetResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FacetResults.
Contains the results of a document attribute/field that is a nested facet. A FacetResult contains the counts for each facet nested within a facet.
For example, the document attribute or facet "Department" includes a value called "Engineering". In addition, the document attribute or facet "SubDepartment" includes the values "Frontend" and "Backend" for documents assigned to "Engineering". You can display nested facets in the search results so that documents can be searched not only by department but also by a sub department within a department. The counts for documents that belong to "Frontend" and "Backend" within "Engineering" are returned for a query.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentInfo
member.summary: Identifies a document for which to retrieve status information

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentInfo.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
Attributes that identify a specific version of a document to check.
The only valid attributes are:
version
datasourceId
jobExecutionId
The attributes follow these rules:
dataSourceId and jobExecutionId must be used together.
version is ignored if dataSourceId and jobExecutionId are not provided.
If dataSourceId and jobExecutionId are provided, but version is not, the version defaults to "0".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentInfo.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The identifier of the document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentMetadataConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the properties, such as relevance tuning and searchability, of an index field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentMetadataConfiguration.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the index field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentMetadataConfiguration.Relevance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Relevance.
Provides tuning parameters to determine how the field affects the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentMetadataConfiguration.Search
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Search.
Provides information about how the field is used during a search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentMetadataConfiguration.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The data type of the index field.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentRelevanceConfiguration
member.summary: Overrides the document relevance properties of a custom index field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentRelevanceConfiguration.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the index field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentRelevanceConfiguration.Relevance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Relevance.
Provides information for tuning the relevance of a field in a search. When a query includes terms that match the field, the results are given a boost in the response based on these tuning parameters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentsMetadataConfiguration
member.summary: Document metadata files that contain information such as the document access control information, source URI, document author, and custom attributes. Each metadata file contains metadata about a single document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.DocumentsMetadataConfiguration.S3Prefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Prefix.
A prefix used to filter metadata configuration files in the Amazon Web Services S3 bucket. The S3 bucket might contain multiple metadata files. Use S3Prefix to include only the desired metadata files.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information for users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source to grant access your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityConfiguration.EntityId
member.summary:

The identifier of a user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source. For example, a user ID could be an email.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityConfiguration.EntityType
member.summary:

Specifies whether you are configuring a User or a Group.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityDisplayData

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityDisplayData.FirstName
member.summary:

The first name of the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityDisplayData.GroupName

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityDisplayData.LastName

The last name of the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityDisplayData.UserName

The name of the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityPersonaConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information for users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source for access to your Amazon Kendra experience. Specific permissions are defined for each user or group once they are granted access to your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityPersonaConfiguration.EntityId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityId.
The identifier of a user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source. For example, a user ID could be an email.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.EntityPersonaConfiguration.Persona
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Persona.
The persona that defines the specific permissions of the user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source. The available personas or access roles are Owner and Viewer. For more information on these personas, see Providing access to your search page.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration information needed to customize how collapsed search result groups expand.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandConfiguration.MaxExpandedResultsPerItem
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxExpandedResultsPerItem.
The number of expanded results to show per collapsed primary document. For instance, if you set this value to 3, then at most 3 results per collapsed group will be displayed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandConfiguration.MaxResultItemsToExpand
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResultItemsToExpand.
The number of collapsed search result groups to expand. If you set this value to 10, for example, only the first 10 out of 100 result groups will have expand functionality.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem
member.summary:
A single expanded result in a collapsed group of search results.
An expanded result item contains information about an expanded result document within a collapsed group of search results. This includes the original location of the document, a list of attributes assigned to the document, and relevant text from the document that satisfies the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem.DocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributes.
An array of document attributes assigned to a document in the search results. For example, the document author ("_author") or the source URI ("_source_uri") of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem.DocumentExcerpt
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DocumentExcerpt.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The idenitifier of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem.DocumentTitle
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DocumentTitle.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem.DocumentURI
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentURI.
The URI of the original location of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExpandedResultItem.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier for the expanded result.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information for your Amazon Kendra experience. This includes the data source IDs and/or FAQ IDs, and user or group information to grant access to your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceConfiguration.ContentSourceConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentSourceConfiguration.
The identifiers of your data sources and FAQs. Or, you can specify that you want to use documents indexed via the BatchPutDocument API. This is the content you want to use for your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceConfiguration.UserIdentityConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserIdentityConfiguration.
The IAM Identity Center field name that contains the identifiers of your users, such as their emails.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEndpoint
member.summary: Provides the configuration information for the endpoint for your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEndpoint.Endpoint
member.summary:

The endpoint of your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEndpoint.EndpointType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointType.
The type of endpoint for your Amazon Kendra experience. The type currently available is HOME, which is a unique and fully hosted URL to the home page of your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEntitiesSummary
member.summary: Summary information for users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source with granted access to your Amazon Kendra experience. You can create an Amazon Kendra experience such as a search application. For more information on creating a search application experience, see Building a search experience with no code.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEntitiesSummary.DisplayData
member.summary:

Information about the user entity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEntitiesSummary.EntityId

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperienceEntitiesSummary.EntityType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityType.
Shows the type as User or Group.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperiencesSummary
member.summary: Summary information for your Amazon Kendra experience. You can create an Amazon Kendra experience such as a search application. For more information on creating a search application experience, see Building a search experience with no code.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperiencesSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when your Amazon Kendra experience was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperiencesSummary.Endpoints
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Endpoints.
The endpoint URLs for your Amazon Kendra experiences. The URLs are unique and fully hosted by Amazon Web Services.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperiencesSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperiencesSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ExperiencesSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The processing status of your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Facet
member.summary:
Information about a document attribute or field. You can use document attributes as facets.
For example, the document attribute or facet "Department" includes the values "HR", "Engineering", and "Accounting". You can display these values in the search results so that documents can be searched by department.
You can display up to 10 facet values per facet for a query. If you want to increase this limit, contact Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Facet.DocumentAttributeKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributeKey.
The unique key for the document attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Facet.Facets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Facets.
An array of document attributes that are nested facets within a facet.
For example, the document attribute or facet "Department" includes a value called "Engineering". In addition, the document attribute or facet "SubDepartment" includes the values "Frontend" and "Backend" for documents assigned to "Engineering". You can display nested facets in the search results so that documents can be searched not only by department but also by a sub department within a department. This helps your users further narrow their search.
You can only have one nested facet within a facet. If you want to increase this limit, contact Support.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Facet.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
Maximum number of facet values per facet. The default is 10. You can use this to limit the number of facet values to less than 10. If you want to increase the default, contact Support.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FacetResult
member.summary: The facet values for the documents in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FacetResult.DocumentAttributeKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributeKey.
The key for the facet values. This is the same as the DocumentAttributeKey provided in the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FacetResult.DocumentAttributeValueCountPairs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributeValueCountPairs.
An array of key/value pairs, where the key is the value of the attribute and the count is the number of documents that share the key value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FacetResult.DocumentAttributeValueType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributeValueType.
The data type of the facet value. This is the same as the type defined for the index field when it was created.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FailedEntity

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FailedEntity.EntityId

The identifier of the user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source. For example, a user ID could be an email.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FailedEntity.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
The reason the user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source failed to properly configure with your Amazon Kendra experience.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FaqSummary.FileFormat
member.summary:

The file type used to create the FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FaqSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FaqSummary.LanguageCode
member.summary:

The code for a language. This shows a supported language for the FAQ document as part of the summary information for FAQs. English is supported by default. For more information on supported languages, including their codes, see Adding documents in languages other than English.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FaqSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name that you assigned the FAQ when you created or updated the FAQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FaqSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the FAQ. When the status is ACTIVE the FAQ is ready for use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FaqSummary.UpdatedAt
member.summary:

The Unix timestamp when the FAQ was last updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocument
member.summary: A featured document. This document is displayed at the top of the search results page, placed above all other results for certain queries. If there's an exact match of a query, then the document is featured in the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocument.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the document to feature in the search results. You can use the Query API to search for specific documents with their document IDs included in the result items, or you can use the console.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocumentMissing
member.summary: A document ID doesn't exist but you have specified as a featured document. Amazon Kendra cannot feature the document if it doesn't exist in the index. You can check the status of a document and its ID or check for documents with status errors using the BatchGetDocumentStatus API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocumentMissing.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the document that doesn't exist but you have specified as a featured document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocumentWithMetadata
member.summary: A featured document with its metadata information. This document is displayed at the top of the search results page, placed above all other results for certain queries. If there's an exact match of a query, then the document is featured in the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocumentWithMetadata.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the featured document with its metadata. You can use the Query API to search for specific documents with their document IDs included in the result items, or you can use the console.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocumentWithMetadata.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The main title of the featured document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedDocumentWithMetadata.URI
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property URI.
The source URI location of the featured document.

member.summary: An error message with a list of conflicting queries used across different sets of featured results. This occurred with the request for a new featured results set. Check that the queries you specified for featured results are unique per featured results set for each index.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConflictingItems.
A list of the conflicting queries, including the query text, the name for the featured results set, and the identifier of the featured results set.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem
member.summary: A single featured result item. A featured result is displayed at the top of the search results page, placed above all other results for certain queries. If there's an exact match of a query, then certain documents are featured in the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.AdditionalAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalAttributes.
One or more additional attributes associated with the featured result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.DocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributes.
An array of document attributes assigned to a featured document in the search results. For example, the document author (_author) or the source URI (_source_uri) of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.DocumentExcerpt
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DocumentExcerpt.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The identifier of the featured document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.DocumentTitle
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DocumentTitle.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.DocumentURI
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentURI.
The source URI location of the featured document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.FeedbackToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeedbackToken.
A token that identifies a particular featured result from a particular query. Use this token to provide click-through feedback for the result. For more information, see Submitting feedback.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of the featured result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsItem.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of document within the featured result response. For example, a response could include a question-answer type that's relevant to the query.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet
member.summary: A set of featured results that are displayed at the top of your search results. Featured results are placed above all other results for certain queries. If there's an exact match of a query, then one or more specific documents are featured in the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.CreationTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTimestamp.
The Unix timestamp when the set of featured results was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description for the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.FeaturedDocuments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedDocuments.
The list of document IDs for the documents you want to feature at the top of the search results page. You can use the Query API to search for specific documents with their document IDs included in the result items, or you can use the console.
You can add up to four featured documents. You can request to increase this limit by contacting Support.
Specific queries are mapped to specific documents for featuring in the results. If a query contains an exact match, then one or more specific documents are featured in the results. The exact match applies to the full query. For example, if you only specify 'Kendra', queries such as 'How does kendra semantically rank results?' will not render the featured results. Featured results are designed for specific queries, rather than queries that are too broad in scope.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.FeaturedResultsSetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedResultsSetId.
The identifier of the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.FeaturedResultsSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedResultsSetName.
The name for the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.LastUpdatedTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedTimestamp.
The Unix timestamp when the set of featured results was last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.QueryTexts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryTexts.
The list of queries for featuring results.
Specific queries are mapped to specific documents for featuring in the results. If a query contains an exact match, then one or more specific documents are featured in the results. The exact match applies to the full query. For example, if you only specify 'Kendra', queries such as 'How does kendra semantically rank results?' will not render the featured results. Featured results are designed for specific queries, rather than queries that are too broad in scope.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSet.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the set of featured results. When the value is ACTIVE, featured results are ready for use. You can still configure your settings before setting the status to ACTIVE. You can set the status to ACTIVE or INACTIVE using the UpdateFeaturedResultsSet API. The queries you specify for featured results must be unique per featured results set for each index, whether the status is ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSetSummary
