member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSetSummary.CreationTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTimestamp.
The Unix timestamp when the set of featured results was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSetSummary.FeaturedResultsSetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedResultsSetId.
The identifier of the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSetSummary.FeaturedResultsSetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedResultsSetName.
The name for the set of featured results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSetSummary.LastUpdatedTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedTimestamp.
The Unix timestamp when the set of featured results was last updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FeaturedResultsSetSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the set of featured results. When the value is ACTIVE, featured results are ready for use. You can still configure your settings before setting the status to ACTIVE. You can set the status to ACTIVE or INACTIVE using the UpdateFeaturedResultsSet API. The queries you specify for featured results must be unique per featured results set for each index, whether the status is ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to Amazon FSx as your data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain files in your Amazon FSx file system. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map Amazon FSx data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Amazon FSx fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Amazon FSx data source field names must exist in your Amazon FSx custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.FileSystemId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemId.
The identifier of the Amazon FSx file system.
You can find your file system ID on the file system dashboard in the Amazon FSx console. For information on how to create a file system in Amazon FSx console, using Windows File Server as an example, see Amazon FSx Getting started guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.FileSystemType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemType.
The Amazon FSx file system type. Windows is currently the only supported type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain files in your Amazon FSx file system. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that contains the key-value pairs required to connect to your Amazon FSx file system. Windows is currently the only supported type. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
username—The Active Directory user name, along with the Domain Name System (DNS) domain name. For example, user@corp.example.com. The Active Directory user account must have read and mounting access to the Amazon FSx file system for Windows.
password—The password of the Active Directory user account with read and mounting access to the Amazon FSx Windows file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.FsxConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.
Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Amazon FSx. Your Amazon FSx instance must reside inside your VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetQuerySuggestions operation. Fetches the queries that are suggested to your users.
GetQuerySuggestions is currently not supported in the Amazon Web Services GovCloud (US-West) region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.AttributeSuggestionsConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeSuggestionsConfig.
Configuration information for the document fields/attributes that you want to base query suggestions on.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to get query suggestions from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.MaxSuggestionsCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxSuggestionsCount.
The maximum number of query suggestions you want to show to your users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.QueryText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryText.
The text of a user's query to generate query suggestions.
A query is suggested if the query prefix matches what a user starts to type as their query.
Amazon Kendra does not show any suggestions if a user types fewer than two characters or more than 60 characters. A query must also have at least one search result and contain at least one word of more than four characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsRequest.SuggestionTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SuggestionTypes.
The suggestions type to base query suggestions on. The suggestion types are query history or document fields/attributes. You can set one type or the other.
If you set query history as your suggestions type, Amazon Kendra suggests queries relevant to your users based on popular queries in the query history.
If you set document fields/attributes as your suggestions type, Amazon Kendra suggests queries relevant to your users based on the contents of document fields.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetQuerySuggestions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsResponse.QuerySuggestionsId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QuerySuggestionsId.
The identifier for a list of query suggestions for an index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetQuerySuggestionsResponse.Suggestions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Suggestions.
A list of query suggestions for an index.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetSnapshots operation. Retrieves search metrics data. The data provides a snapshot of how your users interact with your search application and how effective the application is.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index to get search metrics data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsRequest.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The time interval or time window to get search metrics data. The time interval uses the time zone of your index. You can view data in the following time windows:
THIS_WEEK: The current week, starting on the Sunday and ending on the day before the current date.
ONE_WEEK_AGO: The previous week, starting on the Sunday and ending on the following Saturday.
TWO_WEEKS_AGO: The week before the previous week, starting on the Sunday and ending on the following Saturday.
THIS_MONTH: The current month, starting on the first day of the month and ending on the day before the current date.
ONE_MONTH_AGO: The previous month, starting on the first day of the month and ending on the last day of the month.
TWO_MONTHS_AGO: The month before the previous month, starting on the first day of the month and ending on last day of the month.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of returned data for the metric.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsRequest.MetricType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MetricType.
The metric you want to retrieve. You can specify only one metric per call.
For more information about the metrics you can view, see Gaining insights with search analytics.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If the previous response was incomplete (because there is more data to retrieve), Amazon Kendra returns a pagination token in the response. You can use this pagination token to retrieve the next set of search metrics data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetSnapshots operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If the response is truncated, Amazon Kendra returns this token, which you can use in a later request to retrieve the next set of search metrics data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsResponse.SnapshotsData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotsData.
The search metrics data. The data returned depends on the metric type you requested.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsResponse.SnapshotsDataHeader
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotsDataHeader.
The column headers for the search metrics data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GetSnapshotsResponse.SnapShotTimeFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapShotTimeFilter.
The Unix timestamp for the beginning and end of the time window for the search metrics data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to GitHub as your data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.ExclusionFileNamePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionFileNamePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain file names in your GitHub repository or repositories. File names that match the patterns are excluded from the index. File names that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an exclusion and inclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.ExclusionFileTypePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionFileTypePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain file types in your GitHub repository or repositories. File types that match the patterns are excluded from the index. File types that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an exclusion and inclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.ExclusionFolderNamePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionFolderNamePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain folder names in your GitHub repository or repositories. Folder names that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Folder names that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a folder matches both an exclusion and inclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the folder isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubCommitConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubCommitConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub commits to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.
Configuration information to include certain types of GitHub content. You can configure to index repository files only, or also include issues and pull requests, comments, and comment attachments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubIssueAttachmentConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubIssueAttachmentConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub issue attachments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubIssueCommentConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubIssueCommentConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub issue comments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubIssueDocumentConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubIssueDocumentConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub issues to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubPullRequestCommentConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubPullRequestCommentConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub pull request comments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubPullRequestDocumentAttachmentConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubPullRequestDocumentAttachmentConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub pull request attachments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubPullRequestDocumentConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubPullRequestDocumentConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of GitHub pull requests to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.GitHubRepositoryConfigurationFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GitHubRepositoryConfigurationFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map GitHub repository attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to GitHub fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The GitHub data source field names must exist in your GitHub custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.InclusionFileNamePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionFileNamePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain file names in your GitHub repository or repositories. File names that match the patterns are included in the index. File names that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.InclusionFileTypePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionFileTypePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain file types in your GitHub repository or repositories. File types that match the patterns are included in the index. File types that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.InclusionFolderNamePatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionFolderNamePatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain folder names in your GitHub repository or repositories. Folder names that match the patterns are included in the index. Folder names that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a folder matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the folder isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.OnPremiseConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OnPremiseConfiguration.
Configuration information to connect to GitHub Enterprise Server (on premises).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.RepositoryFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RepositoryFilter.
A list of names of the specific repositories you want to index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.SaaSConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SaaSConfiguration.
Configuration information to connect to GitHub Enterprise Cloud (SaaS).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that contains the key-value pairs required to connect to your GitHub. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
personalToken—The access token created in GitHub. For more information on creating a token in GitHub, see Using a GitHub data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of GitHub service you want to connect to—GitHub Enterprise Cloud (SaaS) or GitHub Enterprise Server (on premises).

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.UseChangeLog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseChangeLog.
TRUE to use the GitHub change log to determine which documents require updating in the index. Depending on the GitHub change log's size, it may take longer for Amazon Kendra to use the change log than to scan all of your documents in GitHub.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.
Configuration information of an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your GitHub. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to include certain types of GitHub content. You can configure to index repository files only, or also include issues and pull requests, comments, and comment attachments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlIssue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlIssue.
TRUE to index all issues within a repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlIssueComment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlIssueComment.
TRUE to index all comments on issues.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlIssueCommentAttachment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlIssueCommentAttachment.
TRUE to include all comment attachments for issues.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlPullRequest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlPullRequest.
TRUE to index all pull requests within a repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlPullRequestComment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlPullRequestComment.
TRUE to index all comments on pull requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlPullRequestCommentAttachment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlPullRequestCommentAttachment.
TRUE to include all comment attachments for pull requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GitHubDocumentCrawlProperties.CrawlRepositoryDocuments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlRepositoryDocuments.
TRUE to index all files with a repository.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to Google Drive as your data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExcludeMimeTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeMimeTypes.
A list of MIME types to exclude from the index. All documents matching the specified MIME type are excluded.
For a list of MIME types, see Using a Google Workspace Drive data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExcludeSharedDrives
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeSharedDrives.
A list of identifiers or shared drives to exclude from the index. All files and folders stored on the shared drive are excluded.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExcludeUserAccounts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExcludeUserAccounts.
A list of email addresses of the users. Documents owned by these users are excluded from the index. Documents shared with excluded users are indexed unless they are excluded in another way.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain items in your Google Drive, including shared drives and users' My Drives. Items that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Items that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
Maps Google Drive data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Google Drive fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Google Drive data source field names must exist in your Google Drive custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain items in your Google Drive, including shared drives and users' My Drives. Items that match the patterns are included in the index. Items that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If an item matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the item isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GoogleDriveConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Secrets Managersecret that contains the credentials required to connect to Google Drive. For more information, see Using a Google Workspace Drive data source.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers
member.summary: A list of users or sub groups that belong to a group. This is useful for user context filtering, where search results are filtered based on the user or their group access to documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers.MemberGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberGroups.
A list of sub groups that belong to a group. For example, the sub groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing" all belong to the group "Company".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers.MemberUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberUsers.
A list of users that belong to a group. For example, a list of interns all belong to the "Interns" group.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupMembers.S3PathforGroupMembers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3PathforGroupMembers.
If you have more than 1000 users and/or sub groups for a single group, you need to provide the path to the S3 file that lists your users and sub groups for a group. Your sub groups can contain more than 1000 users, but the list of sub groups that belong to a group (and/or users) must be no more than 1000.
You can download this example S3 file that uses the correct format for listing group members. Note, dataSourceId is optional. The value of type for a group is always GROUP and for a user it is always USER.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary
member.summary: Summary information on the processing of PUT and DELETE actions for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.FailureReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailureReason.
The reason an action could not be processed. An action can be a PUT or DELETE action for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.LastUpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when an action was last updated. An action can be a PUT or DELETE action for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.OrderingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderingId.
The order in which actions should complete processing. An action can be a PUT or DELETE action for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.ReceivedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReceivedAt.
The Unix timestamp when an action was received by Amazon Kendra. An action can be a PUT or DELETE action for mapping users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupOrderingIdSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current processing status of actions for mapping users to their groups. The status can be either PROCESSING, SUCCEEDED, DELETING, DELETED, or FAILED.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupSummary
member.summary: Summary information for groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupSummary.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
The identifier of the group you want group summary information on.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.GroupSummary.OrderingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderingId.
The timestamp identifier used for the latest PUT or DELETE action.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.HierarchicalPrincipal
member.summary: Information to define the hierarchy for which documents users should have access to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.HierarchicalPrincipal.PrincipalList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrincipalList.
A list of principal lists that define the hierarchy for which documents users should have access to. Each hierarchical list specifies which user or group has allow or deny access for each document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Highlight
member.summary: Provides information that you can use to highlight a search result so that your users can quickly identify terms in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Highlight.BeginOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffset.
The zero-based location in the response string where the highlight starts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Highlight.EndOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffset.
The zero-based location in the response string where the highlight ends.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Highlight.TopAnswer
P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Highlight.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The highlight type.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.HookConfiguration
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information for invoking a Lambda function in Lambda to alter document metadata and content when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra. You can configure your Lambda function using PreExtractionHookConfiguration if you want to apply advanced alterations on the original or raw documents. If you want to apply advanced alterations on the Amazon Kendra structured documents, you must configure your Lambda function using PostExtractionHookConfiguration. You can only invoke one Lambda function. However, this function can invoke other functions it requires.
For more information, see Customizing document metadata during the ingestion process.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.HookConfiguration.InvocationCondition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvocationCondition.
The condition used for when a Lambda function should be invoked.
For example, you can specify a condition that if there are empty date-time values, then Amazon Kendra should invoke a function that inserts the current date-time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.HookConfiguration.LambdaArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LambdaArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to run a Lambda function during ingestion. For more information, see IAM roles for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.HookConfiguration.S3Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Bucket.
Stores the original, raw documents or the structured, parsed documents before and after altering them. For more information, see Data contracts for Lambda functions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary
member.summary: Summary information on the configuration of an index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when the index was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary.Edition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Edition.
Indicates whether the index is a Enterprise Edition index or a Developer Edition index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
A identifier for the index. Use this to identify the index when you are using APIs such as Query, DescribeIndex, UpdateIndex, and DeleteIndex.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the index. When the status is ACTIVE, the index is ready to search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexConfigurationSummary.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when the index was last updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexStatistics
member.summary: Provides information about the number of documents and the number of questions and answers in an index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexStatistics.FaqStatistics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FaqStatistics.
The number of question and answer topics in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.IndexStatistics.TextDocumentStatistics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TextDocumentStatistics.
The number of text documents indexed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.InlineCustomDocumentEnrichmentConfiguration
member.summary:
Provides the configuration information for applying basic logic to alter document metadata and content when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra. To apply advanced logic, to go beyond what you can do with basic logic, see HookConfiguration.
For more information, see Customizing document metadata during the ingestion process.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.InlineCustomDocumentEnrichmentConfiguration.Condition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Condition.
Configuration of the condition used for the target document attribute or metadata field when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.InlineCustomDocumentEnrichmentConfiguration.DocumentContentDeletion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentContentDeletion.
TRUE to delete content if the condition used for the target attribute is met.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.InlineCustomDocumentEnrichmentConfiguration.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
Configuration of the target document attribute or metadata field when ingesting documents into Amazon Kendra. You can also include a value.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to Jira as your data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.AttachmentFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Jira attachments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Jira fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Jira data source field names must exist in your Jira custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.CommentFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CommentFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Jira comments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Jira fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Jira data source field names must exist in your Jira custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain file paths, file names, and file types in your Jira data source. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that don’t match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain file paths, file names, and file types in your Jira data source. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.IssueFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IssueFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Jira issues to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Jira fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Jira data source field names must exist in your Jira custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.IssueSubEntityFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IssueSubEntityFilter.
Specify whether to crawl comments, attachments, and work logs. You can specify one or more of these options.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.IssueType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IssueType.
Specify which issue types to crawl in your Jira data source. You can specify one or more of these options to crawl.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.JiraAccountUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JiraAccountUrl.
The URL of the Jira account. For example, company.atlassian.net.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.Project
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Project.
Specify which projects to crawl in your Jira data source. You can specify one or more Jira project IDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.ProjectFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Jira projects to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Jira fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Jira data source field names must exist in your Jira custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a secret in Secrets Manager contains the key-value pairs required to connect to your Jira data source. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
jiraId—The Jira user name or email.
jiraCredentials—The Jira API token. For more information, see Using a Jira data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Specify which statuses to crawl in your Jira data source. You can specify one or more of these options to crawl.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.UseChangeLog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseChangeLog.
TRUE to use the Jira change log to determine which documents require updating in the index. Depending on the change log's size, it may take longer for Amazon Kendra to use the change log than to scan all of your documents in Jira.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.JiraConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.
Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud to connect to your Jira. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

member.summary:

A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Jira work logs to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Jira fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Jira data source field names must exist in your Jira custom metadata.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to OneDrive as your data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.DisableLocalGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisableLocalGroups.
TRUE to disable local groups information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain documents in your OneDrive. Documents that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are included in the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
The pattern is applied to the file name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.FieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map OneDrive data source attributes or field names to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to OneDrive fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The OneDrive data source field names must exist in your OneDrive custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain documents in your OneDrive. Documents that match the patterns are included in the index. Documents that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a document matches both an inclusion and exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence and the document isn't included in the index.
The pattern is applied to the file name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.OneDriveUsers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OneDriveUsers.
A list of user accounts whose documents should be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Managersecret that contains the user name and password to connect to OneDrive. The user name should be the application ID for the OneDrive application, and the password is the application key for the OneDrive application.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveConfiguration.TenantDomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TenantDomain.
The Azure Active Directory domain of the organization.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveUsers
member.summary: User accounts whose documents should be indexed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveUsers.OneDriveUserList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OneDriveUserList.
A list of users whose documents should be indexed. Specify the user names in email format, for example, username@tenantdomain. If you need to index the documents of more than 100 users, use the OneDriveUserS3Path field to specify the location of a file containing a list of users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OneDriveUsers.OneDriveUserS3Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OneDriveUserS3Path.
The S3 bucket location of a file containing a list of users whose documents should be indexed.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostUrl.
The GitHub host URL or API endpoint URL. For example, https://on-prem-host-url/api/v3/

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OnPremiseConfiguration.OrganizationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrganizationName.
The name of the organization of the GitHub Enterprise Server (in-premise) account you want to connect to. You can find your organization name by logging into GitHub desktop and selecting Your organizations under your profile picture dropdown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.OnPremiseConfiguration.SslCertificateS3Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SslCertificateS3Path.
The path to the SSL certificate stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. You use this to connect to GitHub if you require a secure SSL connection.
You can simply generate a self-signed X509 certificate on any computer using OpenSSL. For an example of using OpenSSL to create an X509 certificate, see Create and sign an X509 certificate.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PersonasSummary
member.summary: Summary information for users or groups in your IAM Identity Center identity source. This applies to users and groups with specific permissions that define their level of access to your Amazon Kendra experience. You can create an Amazon Kendra experience such as a search application. For more information on creating a search application experience, see Building a search experience with no code.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PersonasSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when the summary information was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PersonasSummary.EntityId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityId.
The identifier of a user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source. For example, a user ID could be an email.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PersonasSummary.Persona
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Persona.
The persona that defines the specific permissions of the user or group in your IAM Identity Center identity source. The available personas or access roles are Owner and Viewer. For more information on these personas, see Providing access to your search page.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PersonasSummary.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when the summary information was last updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Principal
member.summary: Provides user and group information for user context filtering.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Principal.Access
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Access.
Whether to allow or deny document access to the principal.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Principal.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The identifier of the data source the principal should access documents from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Principal.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the user or group.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Principal.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of principal.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information for a web proxy to connect to website hosts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration.Credentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Credentials.
Your secret ARN, which you can create in Secrets Manager
The credentials are optional. You use a secret if web proxy credentials are required to connect to a website host. Amazon Kendra currently support basic authentication to connect to a web proxy server. The secret stores your credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration.Host
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Host.
The name of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.
For example, the host name of https://a.example.com/page1.html is "a.example.com".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.ProxyConfiguration.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number of the website host you want to connect to via a web proxy server.
For example, the port for https://a.example.com/page1.html is 443, the standard port for HTTPS.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutPrincipalMapping operation. Maps users to their groups so that you only need to provide the user ID when you issue the query.
You can also map sub groups to groups. For example, the group "Company Intellectual Property Teams" includes sub groups "Research" and "Engineering". These sub groups include their own list of users or people who work in these teams. Only users who work in research and engineering, and therefore belong in the intellectual property group, can see top-secret company documents in their search results.
This is useful for user context filtering, where search results are filtered based on the user or their group access to documents. For more information, see Filtering on user context.
If more than five PUT actions for a group are currently processing, a validation exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.DataSourceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSourceId.
The identifier of the data source you want to map users to their groups.
This is useful if a group is tied to multiple data sources, but you only want the group to access documents of a certain data source. For example, the groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing" are all tied to the company's documents stored in the data sources Confluence and Salesforce. However, "Sales and Marketing" team only needs access to customer-related documents stored in Salesforce.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.GroupId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupId.
The identifier of the group you want to map its users to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.GroupMembers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupMembers.
The list that contains your users or sub groups that belong the same group.
For example, the group "Company" includes the user "CEO" and the sub groups "Research", "Engineering", and "Sales and Marketing".
If you have more than 1000 users and/or sub groups for a single group, you need to provide the path to the S3 file that lists your users and sub groups for a group. Your sub groups can contain more than 1000 users, but the list of sub groups that belong to a group (and/or users) must be no more than 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index you want to map users to their groups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.OrderingId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderingId.
The timestamp identifier you specify to ensure Amazon Kendra does not override the latest PUT action with previous actions. The highest number ID, which is the ordering ID, is the latest action you want to process and apply on top of other actions with lower number IDs. This prevents previous actions with lower number IDs from possibly overriding the latest action.
The ordering ID can be the Unix time of the last update you made to a group members list. You would then provide this list when calling PutPrincipalMapping. This ensures your PUT action for that updated group with the latest members list doesn't get overwritten by earlier PUT actions for the same group which are yet to be processed.
The default ordering ID is the current Unix time in milliseconds that the action was received by Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role that has access to the S3 file that contains your list of users or sub groups that belong to a group.
For more information, see IAM roles for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.PutPrincipalMappingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutPrincipalMapping operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the Query operation. Searches an index given an input query.
If you are working with large language models (LLMs) or implementing retrieval augmented generation (RAG) systems, you can use Amazon Kendra's Retrieve API, which can return longer semantically relevant passages. We recommend using the Retrieve API instead of filing a service limit increase to increase the Query API document excerpt length.
You can configure boosting or relevance tuning at the query level to override boosting at the index level, filter based on document fields/attributes and faceted search, and filter based on the user or their group access to documents. You can also include certain fields in the response that might provide useful additional information.
A query response contains three types of results.
Relevant suggested answers. The answers can be either a text excerpt or table excerpt. The answer can be highlighted in the excerpt.
Matching FAQs or questions-answer from your FAQ file.
Relevant documents. This result type includes an excerpt of the document with the document title. The searched terms can be highlighted in the excerpt.
You can specify that the query return only one type of result using the QueryResultTypeFilter parameter. Each query returns the 100 most relevant results. If you filter result type to only question-answers, a maximum of four results are returned. If you filter result type to only answers, a maximum of three results are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.AttributeFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeFilter.
Filters search results by document fields/attributes. You can only provide one attribute filter; however, the AndAllFilters, NotFilter, and OrAllFilters parameters contain a list of other filters.
The AttributeFilter parameter means you can create a set of filtering rules that a document must satisfy to be included in the query results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.CollapseConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CollapseConfiguration.
Provides configuration to determine how to group results by document attribute value, and how to display them (collapsed or expanded) under a designated primary document for each group.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.DocumentRelevanceOverrideConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentRelevanceOverrideConfigurations.
Overrides relevance tuning configurations of fields/attributes set at the index level.
If you use this API to override the relevance tuning configured at the index level, but there is no relevance tuning configured at the index level, then Amazon Kendra does not apply any relevance tuning.
If there is relevance tuning configured for fields at the index level, and you use this API to override only some of these fields, then for the fields you did not override, the importance is set to 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.Facets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Facets.
An array of documents fields/attributes for faceted search. Amazon Kendra returns a count for each field key specified. This helps your users narrow their search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index for the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.PageNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageNumber.
Query results are returned in pages the size of the PageSize parameter. By default, Amazon Kendra returns the first page of results. Use this parameter to get result pages after the first one.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
Sets the number of results that are returned in each page of results. The default page size is 10. The maximum number of results returned is 100. If you ask for more than 100 results, only 100 are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.QueryResultTypeFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryResultTypeFilter.
Sets the type of query result or response. Only results for the specified type are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.QueryText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryText.
The input query text for the search. Amazon Kendra truncates queries at 30 token words, which excludes punctuation and stop words. Truncation still applies if you use Boolean or more advanced, complex queries.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.RequestedDocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedDocumentAttributes.
An array of document fields/attributes to include in the response. You can limit the response to include certain document fields. By default, all document attributes are included in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.SortingConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortingConfiguration.
Provides information that determines how the results of the query are sorted. You can set the field that Amazon Kendra should sort the results on, and specify whether the results should be sorted in ascending or descending order. In the case of ties in sorting the results, the results are sorted by relevance.
If you don't provide sorting configuration, the results are sorted by the relevance that Amazon Kendra determines for the result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.SortingConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortingConfigurations.
Provides configuration information to determine how the results of a query are sorted.
You can set upto 3 fields that Amazon Kendra should sort the results on, and specify whether the results should be sorted in ascending or descending order. The sort field quota can be increased.
If you don't provide a sorting configuration, the results are sorted by the relevance that Amazon Kendra determines for the result. In the case of ties in sorting the results, the results are sorted by relevance.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.SpellCorrectionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpellCorrectionConfiguration.
Enables suggested spell corrections for queries.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.UserContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserContext.
The user context token or user and group information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryRequest.VisitorId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VisitorId.
Provides an identifier for a specific user. The VisitorId should be a unique identifier, such as a GUID. Don't use personally identifiable information, such as the user's email address, as the VisitorId.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the Query operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.FacetResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FacetResults.
Contains the facet results. A FacetResult contains the counts for each field/attribute key that was specified in the Facets input parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.FeaturedResultsItems
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeaturedResultsItems.
The list of featured result items. Featured results are displayed at the top of the search results page, placed above all other results for certain queries. If there's an exact match of a query, then certain documents are featured in the search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.QueryId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryId.
The identifier for the search. You also use QueryId to identify the search when using the SubmitFeedback API.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.ResultItems
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResultItems.
The results of the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.SpellCorrectedQueries
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpellCorrectedQueries.
A list of information related to suggested spell corrections for a query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.TotalNumberOfResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalNumberOfResults.
The total number of items found by the search. However, you can only retrieve up to 100 items. For example, if the search found 192 items, you can only retrieve the first 100 of the items.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResponse.Warnings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Warnings.
A list of warning codes and their messages on problems with your query.
Amazon Kendra currently only supports one type of warning, which is a warning on invalid syntax used in the query. For examples of invalid query syntax, see Searching with advanced query syntax.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem
member.summary:
A single query result.
A query result contains information about a document returned by the query. This includes the original location of the document, a list of attributes assigned to the document, and relevant text from the document that satisfies the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.AdditionalAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalAttributes.
One or more additional fields/attributes associated with the query result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.CollapsedResultDetail
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CollapsedResultDetail.
Provides details about a collapsed group of search results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentAttributes.
An array of document fields/attributes assigned to a document in the search results. For example, the document author (_author) or the source URI (_source_uri) of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentExcerpt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentExcerpt.
An extract of the text in the document. Contains information about highlighting the relevant terms in the excerpt.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The identifier for the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentTitle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentTitle.
The title of the document. Contains the text of the title and information for highlighting the relevant terms in the title.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.DocumentURI
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentURI.
The URI of the original location of the document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.FeedbackToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FeedbackToken.
A token that identifies a particular result from a particular query. Use this token to provide click-through feedback for the result. For more information, see Submitting feedback.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.Format
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Format.
If the Type of document within the response is ANSWER, then it is either a TABLE answer or TEXT answer. If it's a table answer, a table excerpt is returned in TableExcerpt. If it's a text answer, a text excerpt is returned in DocumentExcerpt.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier for the query result.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.ScoreAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScoreAttributes.
Indicates the confidence level of Amazon Kendra providing a relevant result for the query. Each result is placed into a bin that indicates the confidence, VERY_HIGH, HIGH, MEDIUM and LOW. You can use the score to determine if a response meets the confidence needed for your application.
The field is only set to LOW when the Type field is set to DOCUMENT and Amazon Kendra is not confident that the result is relevant to the query.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.TableExcerpt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TableExcerpt.
An excerpt from a table within a document.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QueryResultItem.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of document within the response. For example, a response could include a question-answer that's relevant to the query.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary
member.summary:
Summary information on a query suggestions block list.
This includes information on the block list ID, block list name, when the block list was created, when the block list was last updated, and the count of block words/phrases in the block list.
For information on the current quota limits for block lists, see Quotas for Amazon Kendra.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when the block list was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier of a block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.ItemCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemCount.
The number of items in the block list file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the block list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuerySuggestionsBlockListSummary.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The Unix timestamp when the block list was last updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the configuration information to connect to Quip as your data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.AttachmentFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttachmentFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Quip attachments to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Quip fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Quip field names must exist in your Quip custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.CrawlAttachments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlAttachments.
TRUE to index attachments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.CrawlChatRooms
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlChatRooms.
TRUE to index the contents of chat rooms.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.CrawlFileComments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CrawlFileComments.
TRUE to index file comments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
The Quip site domain. For example, https://quip-company.quipdomain.com/browse. The domain in this example is "quipdomain".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.ExclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to exclude certain files in your Quip file system. Files that match the patterns are excluded from the index. Files that don’t match the patterns are included in the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence, and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.FolderIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FolderIds.
The identifiers of the Quip folders you want to index. You can find the folder ID in your browser URL when you access your folder in Quip. For example, https://quip-company.quipdomain.com/zlLuOVNSarTL/folder-name. The folder ID in this example is "zlLuOVNSarTL".

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.InclusionPatterns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusionPatterns.
A list of regular expression patterns to include certain files in your Quip file system. Files that match the patterns are included in the index. Files that don't match the patterns are excluded from the index. If a file matches both an inclusion pattern and an exclusion pattern, the exclusion pattern takes precedence, and the file isn't included in the index.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.MessageFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Quip messages to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Quip fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Quip field names must exist in your Quip custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Secrets Manager secret that contains the key-value pairs that are required to connect to your Quip. The secret must contain a JSON structure with the following keys:
accessToken—The token created in Quip. For more information, see Using a Quip data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.ThreadFieldMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThreadFieldMappings.
A list of DataSourceToIndexFieldMapping objects that map attributes or field names of Quip threads to Amazon Kendra index field names. To create custom fields, use the UpdateIndex API before you map to Quip fields. For more information, see Mapping data source fields. The Quip field names must exist in your Quip custom metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.QuipConfiguration.VpcConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfiguration.
Configuration information for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to connect to your Quip. For more information, see Configuring a VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance
member.summary: Provides information for tuning the relevance of a field in a search. When a query includes terms that match the field, the results are given a boost in the response based on these tuning parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.Duration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Duration.
Specifies the time period that the boost applies to. For example, to make the boost apply to documents with the field value within the last month, you would use "2628000s". Once the field value is beyond the specified range, the effect of the boost drops off. The higher the importance, the faster the effect drops off. If you don't specify a value, the default is 3 months. The value of the field is a numeric string followed by the character "s", for example "86400s" for one day, or "604800s" for one week.
Only applies to DATE fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.Freshness
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Freshness.
Indicates that this field determines how "fresh" a document is. For example, if document 1 was created on November 5, and document 2 was created on October 31, document 1 is "fresher" than document 2. You can only set the Freshness field on one DATE type field. Only applies to DATE fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.Importance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Importance.
The relative importance of the field in the search. Larger numbers provide more of a boost than smaller numbers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.RankOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RankOrder.
Determines how values should be interpreted.
When the RankOrder field is ASCENDING, higher numbers are better. For example, a document with a rating score of 10 is higher ranking than a document with a rating score of 1.
When the RankOrder field is DESCENDING, lower numbers are better. For example, in a task tracking application, a priority 1 task is more important than a priority 5 task.
Only applies to LONG and DOUBLE fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.Relevance.ValueImportanceMap
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValueImportanceMap.
A list of values that should be given a different boost when they appear in the result list. For example, if you are boosting a field called "department," query terms that match the department field are boosted in the result. However, you can add entries from the department field to boost documents with those values higher.
For example, you can add entries to the map with names of departments. If you add "HR",5 and "Legal",3 those departments are given special attention when they appear in the metadata of a document. When those terms appear they are given the specified importance instead of the regular importance for the boost.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RelevanceFeedback
member.summary: Provides feedback on how relevant a document is to a search. Your application uses the SubmitFeedback API to provide relevance information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RelevanceFeedback.RelevanceValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelevanceValue.
Whether the document was relevant or not relevant to the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RelevanceFeedback.ResultId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResultId.
The identifier of the search result that the user provided relevance feedback for.

member.name: T:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the Retrieve operation. Retrieves relevant passages or text excerpts given an input query.
This API is similar to the Query API. However, by default, the Query API only returns excerpt passages of up to 100 token words. With the Retrieve API, you can retrieve longer passages of up to 200 token words and up to 100 semantically relevant passages. This doesn't include question-answer or FAQ type responses from your index. The passages are text excerpts that can be semantically extracted from multiple documents and multiple parts of the same document. If in extreme cases your documents produce zero passages using the Retrieve API, you can alternatively use the Query API and its types of responses.
You can also do the following:
Override boosting at the index level
Filter based on document fields or attributes
Filter based on the user or their group access to documents
View the confidence score bucket for a retrieved passage result. The confidence bucket provides a relative ranking that indicates how confident Amazon Kendra is that the response is relevant to the query.
Confidence score buckets are currently available only for English.
You can also include certain fields in the response that might provide useful additional information.
The Retrieve API shares the number of query capacity units that you set for your index. For more information on what's included in a single capacity unit and the default base capacity for an index, see Adjusting capacity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.AttributeFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeFilter.
Filters search results by document fields/attributes. You can only provide one attribute filter; however, the AndAllFilters, NotFilter, and OrAllFilters parameters contain a list of other filters.
The AttributeFilter parameter means you can create a set of filtering rules that a document must satisfy to be included in the query results.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.DocumentRelevanceOverrideConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentRelevanceOverrideConfigurations.
Overrides relevance tuning configurations of fields/attributes set at the index level.
If you use this API to override the relevance tuning configured at the index level, but there is no relevance tuning configured at the index level, then Amazon Kendra does not apply any relevance tuning.
If there is relevance tuning configured for fields at the index level, and you use this API to override only some of these fields, then for the fields you did not override, the importance is set to 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.IndexId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IndexId.
The identifier of the index to retrieve relevant passages for the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.PageNumber
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageNumber.
Retrieved relevant passages are returned in pages the size of the PageSize parameter. By default, Amazon Kendra returns the first page of results. Use this parameter to get result pages after the first one.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
Sets the number of retrieved relevant passages that are returned in each page of results. The default page size is 10. The maximum number of results returned is 100. If you ask for more than 100 results, only 100 are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.QueryText
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryText.
The input query text to retrieve relevant passages for the search. Amazon Kendra truncates queries at 30 token words, which excludes punctuation and stop words. Truncation still applies if you use Boolean or more advanced, complex queries.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.RequestedDocumentAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedDocumentAttributes.
A list of document fields/attributes to include in the response. You can limit the response to include certain document fields. By default, all document fields are included in the response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveRequest.UserContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserContext.
The user context token or user and group information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveResponse.QueryId

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveResponse.ResultItems
member.summary:

The results of the retrieved relevant passages for the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.Kendra.Model.RetrieveResultItem.DocumentId
member.summary:

The identifier of the document.
